# dividerColor

**Instance Property**

The color of the dividers that the split view draws between subviews.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying @MainActor var dividerColor: NSColor { get }
```

## Discussion

The default implementation of this method returns [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColor/clear] when the split view’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/dividerStyle-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/DividerStyle-swift.enum/thick], or when [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/dividerStyle-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/DividerStyle-swift.enum/paneSplitter] and the split view is in a textured window. The system draws all other thin dividers with a color that provides appropriate contrast between two white panes.

You can subclass [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView] and override this method to change the color of dividers.

## Configuring and Drawing Dividers

- **dividerStyle**: The style of divider between views.
- **NSSplitView.DividerStyle**: Constants that specify the style of the split view’s dividers.
- **dividerThickness**: The thickness of the dividers for the split view.
- **drawDivider(in:)**: Draws a divider between two of the split view’s subviews.
